sections.title: Structural Requirements
sections.summary: Guidelines for the design and construction of structural systems to ensure safety and performance.

articles.title: Foundations
articles.description: Foundations must be designed to safely transmit loads to the ground without causing settlement or instability.
requirements: Soil test must be conducted for all multi-storey buildings.
Footings should extend below the frost line or as determined by soil investigation.
Use reinforced concrete for foundations in weak soil conditions.

articles.title: Columns and Beams
articles.description: All load-bearing members shall comply with reinforced concrete design standards.
requirements: Minimum concrete strength: 20 N/mmÂ² for residential.
Provide stirrups at 150mm c/c in seismic zones.

sections.title: Fire Safety and Egress
sections.summary: Provisions to ensure fire safety, evacuation, and fire resistance of materials.

articles.title: Fire Resistance
articles.description: All materials used in escape routes must be non-combustible.
requirements: Provide at least two exits for assembly buildings.
